Transparency.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Teaming Up on AI Models & Data
relevantSources.summary: Panel discussion on AI model sharing, data governance, and collaboration frameworks across utilities.

relevantSources.title: 2024 R&D Strategy Report Executive Summary
relevantSources.summary: Executive summary outlining AI integration strategy with emphasis on responsible AI deployment.

Transparency.findings: PG&E provides concrete evidence of transparency in its AI practices through detailed strategy reports and public documentation of model sharing and governance frameworks. These sources describe transparent AI strategies, data governance, and collaborative efforts with other utilities.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 1 because 3 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging - PG&E
relevantSources.summary: Corporate commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion principles that inform technology development and deployment.

relevantSources.title: Charting New Horizons: AI-Driven Utility Innovations
relevantSources.summary: Article discussing PG&E's AI committee focused on establishing governance for ethical AI applications with diverse perspectives.

relevantSources.title: Beyond Algorithmic Fairness: A Guide to Develop and Deploy Responsible AI-Enabled Optimization
relevantSources.summary: Research paper co-authored with PG&E on ethical AI optimization addressing fairness, bias mitigation, and equity in power systems.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: PG&E demonstrates concrete actions toward fairness and bias mitigation in AI through its public DEI commitments, the existence of an AI ethics committee, and academic collaborations on fairness in power systems. These sources provide both organizational and technical evidence of bias mitigation practices.

relevantSources.summary: LinkedIn post highlighting explainable AI identifying inefficiencies in utility operations.

Explainability.findings: PG&E provides concrete evidence of explainability in its AI systems, including documented use of explainable decision-making algorithms for critical infrastructure and public discussion of explainable AI in operational contexts. These sources highlight the company's commitment to transparency and customer trust in AI deployment.

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: PG&E's public documents describe explicit human oversight in AI operations, including strategy reports and panel discussions that emphasize human-in-the-loop approaches. These sources show that human accountability and ethical decision-making are embedded in their AI deployment processes.

Privacy & Security.findings: PG&E provides concrete evidence of privacy and security practices in AI, including supplier code requirements for AI tool usage and detailed data protection protocols. These documents show a strong focus on safeguarding customer information and operational data.

summary.overallFindings: PG&E Corporation demonstrates comprehensive responsible AI practices across all seven pillars, with detailed evidence for transparency, fairness, explainability, human oversight, privacy, governance, and public commitments. The company provides public documentation, strategy reports, and external collaborations that collectively showcase robust frameworks and implementation. No significant gaps were identified, indicating a mature and well-documented approach to responsible AI. PG&E's practices set a strong example for responsible AI in the utility sector.
